subject: Re: Older 12-470 on ebay
author: M.A. Coletta (Mike)
full_text:
Hi LC,

Yes, it does take a bit more tweaking and adjusting when using the 
chamber; just to get the volume levels set properly to be able to 
hear the raw audio clearly.  My fist sesion ever was with the older 
12-470 in the open air, using a digital recorder.  I got results 
during that one.  I have yet to run a real session (other than some 
testing) with my other configurations.
Maybe later this week sometime.

Thanks for sharing!
- Mike

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "LC Duplatt" <lcdupla@...> wrote:
>
> Mike, I had an incredible session yesterday with the 12-469 and 
amped 
> speakers.  I have not uploaded the file, yet, but I am ruined.  
Great 
> questioning and answering...very discernable.  It seems when the 
> person operating the device tunes in, the mish mash of audio bits 
> become something else when the spirits start using it.
> 
> As Halliday said, no box needed with these radios.  The box made it 
> difficult to record clearer voices and made things a bit muffled 
for 
> me.  I made an echo chamber and used a sound chamber, but didn't 
like 
> it as well.  The amplified speakers seem to give a nice "hiss" 
which 
> fills in the gaps with white noise (?), but that hiss makes it 
> difficult for clarity when dropped in a chamber. 
> 
> Now I am excited to use the 12-470 (older version) without the 
> chambers and with (just to compare, as well).
> 
> LC
> http://www.AngelsGhosts.com
> 
> 
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "M.A. Coletta (Mike)" 
> <michaelcoletta@> wrote:
> >
> > Ahhh... Welcome to the world of 12-470 (older version) 
ownership.  
> I 
> > think you will find it a bit better than the 12-469, in my 
opinion 
> > anyway.  I guess since I own both models... I can say that after 
a 
> > side by side comparison.  You can say goodbye to that AM sweep 
> > clicking found on the 12-469, anyway.
> > 
> > Enjoy your new experimental device... once it arrives!
> > 
> > - Mike
> > 
> > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "LC Duplatt" <lcdupla@> wrote:
> > >
> > > Mike,
> > > 
> > > Thank you.  I had to pay a pretty price for it, but I need it 
for 
> > my 
> > > experiments and there are none left around here.
> > > 
> > > LC
> > >
